"Register a new sensor.

"
"• Select the "New sensor" button in the first page.
" "• Approach the sensor to the NFC antenna of your phone to get the id.
" "• A page will open, choose a name for the sensor (usually the locality where it is installed).
" "• Select the localisation thanks to the button "Pick a place" 
" "• Enter the depth of the sensor under the ground level (usually the length of the string).
" "• Press "Save" to enter the data in your database.

"
"Get information on a sensor.

"
"• Select the "Get info" button in the first page.
" "• Approach the sensor to the NFC antenna of your phone to get the id.
" "• If the sensor is registered in your database, a page will open and display its characteristics.
" "• If not, a dialog box will suggest you to register it.

"
"Launch the Samplings.

"
"• Select the "Launch Samplings" button in the first page.
" "• A dialog box will open, enter the sampling period that you want and press "OK" 
" "• Approach the sensor to the NFC antenna of your phone to start to the sensor.
" "• You can now let the sensor in the water.

"
"Collect the data.

"
"• Select the "Collect Data" button in the first page.
" "• Approach the sensor to the NFC antenna of your phone and do not move until all the data has been collected.
" "• Once the progress bar is completed, you can disconnect the sensor.

"
"Edit the characteristics of a sensor.

"
"• Go on the characteristics page of the sensor (can be accessed through the map, the "My sensors" list or the "Get info" on the main page if you have the sensor).
" "• Press on the settings button (top-right).
" "• Select "Edit" 
" "• Change the fields you wish (the location can be set through the "Pick a place" button).
" "• Press "Save" 

"
"Visualise the data.

"
"• Go on the characteristics page of the sensor (can be accessed through the map, the "My sensors" list or the "Get info" on the main page if you have the sensor).
" "• Press on the settings button (top-right).
" "• Select "View Data" 
" "• A page with a graph will open these are raw pressures, not compensated with the atmospheric pressure.
" "• You can zoom and navigate in the graph.

"
"See the sensor on the map.

"
"• Go on map page (can be accessed through the "Map" in the drawer of the main page, or the sensor's characteristics page in "Settings", "View on map").
" "• You can see the name of the sensor by clicking on it, and more characteristics if you click on the "Get info" button.

"
"Log out.

"
"• Open the drawer in the main page, select "My account" 
" "• You can see characteristics of your account and press "Log out" 

"
"Contacts permissions are needed for providing email completions."
